QjIA3_zPZaJG1TPnlQIg_g.text: Decent Chicken burger and Ari burger. Fries were a tad overcooked, but offering hot sauce is a great idea. Nice, clean tables, great for an afternoon snack. Black lady with curly hair at the counter was a bit rude - she didn't want to take our order and looked unhappy having to serve our burgers to our table. So, good food, lacklustre service.

tKiRgQA6N4SfqQCv_jQO8g.text: Definitely the messiest burger I have ever eaten but it was worth it! Wow! What a taste!And the fries were awesome too. And the hot sauce! And the staff were cool!

PVF4IwoH4mDTgynh79qn-Q.text: Excellent burgers! I ordered the Smokey Robinson and it was one of the best burgers I've had. Friendly staff and fast service.

s7jJNhME0K4X3dOAF11MbA.text: Decent burger but not a great bun, a bit dry and bland. Not unhappy but likely wouldn't come back. Too many other options out there.

j5czgcPy7KgkafkDBCS9aw.text: Probably one of the best burgers ever. Long queues at lunch time, but it was worth the wait. Chicken skin mayonnaise with chips was amazing and something I'd never had before. Wish it had been quicker to get in so I could have enjoyed it more! Also, they were playing GREAT music :)

GJeIAPKWT0LxH59jiiVe-Q.text: Brioche buns  simple menu  cooked to spec  and pale ale  basically this place ticks all of the boxes. I only wish there was a little more seating. The Staff are friendly and attentive and the prices are reasonable. What else can I say? Not much, apart from the fact that this place is better than the infamous meat mission.

6Hz2UUdVgXk0VdvnXyeONw.text: Solid burger in the UK?  Hard for me to believe but yes this is a good burger and cooked well. Service was good and quick the burger was messy and delicious can't go wrong

Qlrb8QVjqB1KXiKIB99JtQ.text: For a fast, good burger and some special chips, Patty and Bun is a perfect choice.  The burger is all-meat, not a meatloaf-like blend, as one still finds at times on this side of the pond.  It's not top quality, but for the fast presentation, it's many steps above typical fast food.  The brioche bun was delicious, warm and soft.  The rosemary chips are salty and flavorful.  Yum!

AGzLEYQqF2RYe2Ov-xJgFg.text: The burgers were nice but quite greasy. It was delicious but i could tell how fatty it was. And there wasn't a lot of seating area so we had to wait for a while to sit down.

dOAlppHv_Z-9Mpkgv9z4qQ.text: For some reason I've not reviewed the original P&B yet.  Weird.  That'll be up next...Patty & Bun Liverpool Street is the one and only answer to the question "where can I go to get myself covered in meaty sauce, grease, and self-loathing without having to queue?".  It probably goes without saying, but P&B make the second biggest slopfest burger available in this city (the first going to Lucky Chip, in particular their Leviathanic Bill Murray burger).  The Liverpool Street branch is a dinky little place next to the station which kind of strikes me as an ex-Pret (ha, as if a Pret in the City would close down).  We managed to get a small table as soon as we got there at 7.30 on a weekday.  Who knew?So, firstly, don't get the grapefruit drink Ting.  It's kind of like an unpleasant 100 Plus (SE Asia represent) and wasn't particularly refreshing.  I was only ever going to get a Smoky Robinson - and yes, it's as drippy McSlopface as the other P&B.  I will say though - hence the 4* - that the burger was rather less flavourful than either the Bond Street branch or their street food stall. Not that it wasn't good, but I did think the meat lacked the punch that I'm used to.  I mean, all the usual post-meal symptoms (bloating, chest tightening, greasy face ooze, increased feelings of shame) were present, it just wasn't quite as satisfying as I know they can be.  It may just have been the particular day, but I wonder if they source their stuff from the same place.  Despite that though, it's still better than most and the lack of wait would bring a smile to Jay Rayner's face.  I'll be interested to see how the quality holds up at any further branches of P&B - hopefully this one's just a minor blip.

5Hj472-XE5ZLyOXImQGX-w.text: My favourite burger so far in London. The "Ari Gold" burger is exceptional. As is the chicken burger. The Rosemary fries are fantastic too.The music could be a bit better, there could be more/better seating, better music played and fries with every burger. But besides that, this is the best burger i've had in London.

OHSwaX4G3wTtyHkq8u2jmA.text: The best burger I've ever had! So succulent and flavorsome. To put it simply, get down here and try them out!

38r2ClMFIcI7_QjUbYIQwA.text: Wow. Perfect place to grab a quick but excellent burger.Great vibe, workers are super professionals.MUCH BETTER than "Honest Bur".Thanks guys @ P&B, I love you :)

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Yummy. So good. The music is also awesome.
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

93vAv71vnuH9IDL03JumDQ.text: I've tried Dirty Burger, GBK, Honest, Porky's, Bleecker, Tommi's, MeatLiquor....basically I've eaten a whole cow worth of burgers! Patty & Bun's Ari Gold comes out on top for me. That sauce and pickled onion - OMG! Incredibly delicious!! The toppings in this burger are the best I've had.  And it's so messy, greasy and cheesy. A real treat.Another outstanding thing about the burger though is the patty. Chunky pieces of tender beef within the bun. I loved the texture and it was cooked perfectly. Shoutout to the chicken wings side. You were great but the burger stole your thunder.Best. Burger. In. London. /end

xkW99Z1w13WTaV-e4XehLA.text: Delicious burger place that is the best burger I've had in London other than Lucky Chip (I used to work for the latter though so may be slightly biased although I have NO interest in endorsing them in any shape whatsoever, purely a taste thing). I've had the burger at the London Fields branch as well as delivered via Deliveroo, via the Liverpool st. branch.The fries are really interesting, with one option being chicken skin salt flavour fries - this is basically a seasoning made out of salt and ground up bits of crispy chicken skin, which may sound weird but is pretty delicious - the chicken gives the seasoning an umami like taste and the chicken skin flavoured mayo is also pretty satisfying. Also liked the rosemary fries.In terms of the burger, it can get a bit soggy as there is a lot of juice coming out of the meat + sauce inside but other than that it's pretty much a 5 star burger - great charred flavour meat, gooey cheese and great spicy mayo sauce. I've also tasted the veggie burger as my sister is a vegetarian and she said it is easily one of the best veggie burgers she's ever had, especially compared to similar veggie options as places like Byron and so on. The veggie is basically a deep fried battered mushroom sandwiched in between bits of a garlicky, almost truffle-y creamy sauce - delicious.

oszlXg2K17sU_ymy-mL_yw.text: London has so many burger places, with so many new restaurants opening in the last few years. This one is right up there with the best.They have five different burgers. My favourite is the Smokey Robinson (their bacon burger). They cook the beef patty to your liking; they recommend medium and I go with that. I like the burger as a whole because of the juicy patty, the P&B mayo and, of course, the bacon. The bun holds up well and doesn't turn soggy (like I have experienced at other places).It gets quite busy at lunchtimes given its prime location outside Liverpool Street station. They have an efficient takeaway service, so you can leave with your burger to eat nearby.

j8bdHGG_EdOHAUTGw6otBA.text: I've gone on record saying that the Patty and Bun veggie burger is the best I've ever had ANYWHERE.  And dang it, if it doesn't hold up again and again!!  (The chilli sauce which is house-made, is totally something I could write an ode to on my heart using indelible ink :)This location is a little more fast-food than the original but the staff are awesome - and the music, goddamn, I *never* notice the soundtrack in places but I was here a couple mins before opening, and they let me sit in the warmth and jam along with them to 90s HipHop. I could fall in love with the staff here.God bless Patty and Bun. May you take over the world :D

Q3lOJtLQSexgMhAll3CcPQ.text: Great place to grab a quick burger for lunch or dinner. They have some interesting options on the menu; the Ari Gold with Bacon is a classic though. You can't go wrong with that. The meat is high quality, at a reasonable price and it is made quickly and efficiently. Not much more i can ask for from a burger joint.

HjbFmZkXNw3h0ib39wrFJQ.text: This is one of the best burgers I have had in London albeit a bit pricey. I did find the pickled onion a bit too sour, it was a flavour that took over. I don't eat pork so the caramelized onion option was not a winner as it cooked with pancetta. Otherwise, the bun, sauce, perfectly cooked meat was amazing. The fries were also brilliant some of the best I've had. Nice and crispy but not overcooked and delicious with the rosemary salt.I am giving it 4 stars and not 5 for the lack of drink variety, proper seating and lack of milkshakes. We had to go to the Diner after for a milk shake. They really need to sort something out and offer more variety.

DX6zUJD2JW7w4ogc56gquA.text: It's Arri burger never fails me... Avoid lunch hour... Really busy and long queue... But all very worth it... If you're not really hungry, no need for chips. You'll be stuffed already from the burger.

0Hi8v-hZocBsk7iy7dcfRA.text: Really yummy place. Simple menu. Had a few specialty burgers on the menu and mine was really tasty. The fries that came with the burger were really good, too. Place is pretty small and loud but I enjoyed my visit here. Wouldn't hesitate going back here.

kCJUVCZpqvKaOn7x470vLQ.text: Patty and bun is decent, but I wouldn't say it's a 5 starer (hence why I haven't given it 5 stars). Generally I'm underwhelmed by burger places. You get loads of hype and then a burger. Which is good, but still just a burger. Patty and Bun is most definitely better than most! But it's still just a burger. Their breakfast burger things (I had sausage, lots of my friends has bacon) were fine. But to be honest whilst eating it I felt it was trying (and failing) to rival the pinnacle of excellence that is the double sausage and egg mcmuffin. Maybe my love of the mcmuffin will help inform you as to whether or not to disregard this review ;)Their lunch burgers are decent, but they won't change your life and I don't find myself craving them as I do many other burger places. Generally this place is fine, but I think they're riding the fancy burger wave. They throw good ingredients in but then the burgers seem to disappoint, possibly because I expect so much after their near poetic descriptions.

tv1Vc9vicTUWvXYOVkg3nA.text: Very tasty burger cooked quickly. Simple menu. Good stuff. Great location right across from Liverpool train station

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Menu

hCpR70enTUVVHn06vJ3tbw.text: THIS PLACE IS LIFE CHANGING. I've been to the Patty & Bun at Oxford Circus before, but had to queue and didn't think the lamb burger was worth the long wait. But this location is set up like a lunch takeaway, and was even queue-less when we stopped by after work drinks on a Friday night! My friend and I both got the Smokey Robinson and shared some chips. The server asked us how we wanted our burger, and medium rare turned out to be perfectly pink and juicy, and the brioche was heavenly. And while we were waiting, the server heard us talking about BBQ sauce in America, then he came over and brought us a side of homemade BBQ sauce, which was such a kind gesture! I cannot wait to come back again.

b9i3qZOaKYua9DHXQ5oCGQ.text: Probably one of the better burger places I have been to recently...it is messy, it is greasy and it is great. Perfect for a dirty lunch or a post-hangover-grease-feast.Robinson burger was awesome.

B6ZsuVN_b29dQ2crWMg6hg.text: But if you have a service/assistance dog, you will be turned away.There is a MacDonald's across the street.

XMVgNK3gWcRnUhYkqVj1aA.text: No burger tour of London (which is what I consider the last two years I've spent here - a burger tour) could be complete without a trip to Patty & Bun. It's taken me a while to get here, but to be fair, there are many purveyors of fine burgers in this city!Two things make Patty & Bun worth your time: the patty and the sauce. Oh my sweet delicious burger sauce... I can take or leave a brioche bun, although they do help to contain even the juiciest of burgers - and these burgers are definitely juicy.I went with an Ari Gold + bacon. My bacon was way overcooked, and really, the Ari Gold is burger enough without it, so I wouldn't recommend. The hand cut rosemary chips were tasty, but a bit much on top of my burger, and the serving size is massive.4 stars, Patty & Bun!

0KqTTtsMAxrslRFwMlLdqg.text: If I remember correctly, I had the Smokey Robinson (whichever one has onions and bacon) and it was pretty good.  I've had better back home, but I would say this is probably the best in London.  Plus the burger sauce they use goes very well with everything.  And the rosemary and salt chips were amazing - definitely doing this at home.  Overall, great food but they need a bigger restaurant.

SqaIDeb_nvhQQRaYjYP34A.text: Our first meal in London! Loved the atmosphere with great, up beat music playing!  The burgers are amazing and plentiful!

PMM9dtAesYCN7I0V6U_zqQ.text: OK the burger was delicious and tender. The sauce different from the same stuff you can normally eat elsewhere.However £8.50 for a takeaway with no chips is too exaggerated.I'm not sure whether I'll be back again.

N40zH1GEywV15L2j-HP1MQ.text: Has a sort of hip vibe. People have a 'this is where it's at and that's why I'm here' look on their faces.I like the look of the place and the staff are friendly, but my burger was so greasy and covered in a slimy mess of, I'm not sure....so it kept slipping outside the bun. It was a bit like eating an ice cream cone on a hot summer's day...you race to finish it before it's melted.The french fries were a little too salty and over-seasoned.Afterwards I sort of had the 'I've just eaten junk food' feeling.Most of my clothes are now in the machine...it splashed all over me.BUT...this won't put me off giving this place another chance because it's so...likeable and I'm beginning to think this is the way people like their hamburgers these days and I'm willing to adapt. I'll also be ready for the splash effect next time.

LgggWc9iQNe6IO9TSyd-VQ.text: The Jose Jose burger is without a doubt the best burger I've ever eaten so far!Located just outside of the Liverpool St. Station you can find P&B. The place itself is definately not a place to settle for long as the place is not really big, pretty loud and the seats not really comfortable, but it is a place worth visiting if you want to eat a slobby and tasty burger with some delicious siders. We normally don't have to wait for long to get a table, but I can imagine that this can vary according to when you go there. The menu is simple: 4 burgers & a special burger, some siders, chicken wings and chicken legs, that's it. But it's the simplicity that makes this place so special to me. Each burger is just to the point and makes it really hard to decide what to get. I normally chose the Jose Jose buger and get some fries with chicken roast skin salt mayo. In addition one has to mention the harrissa ketchup sauce on every table which is pure damage. Got myself a 250ml portion to take away to Germany and I use it whereever I can.

_aaInT1tOy-3m9MwL42hYg.text: I occasionally eat meat and when I do I make sure I go for the Hot Chic Chicken Burger. It oozes flavour and freshness, it is quite filling on its own or great with a side portion of rosemary fries. All I can say is Patty & Bun did good!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Indeed this is the scrumptious Hot Chic Chicken Burger

eyKloQvelEKbjo49guG96w.text: One word for the low mark: ketchup ... Tasted stronger than the meat and cheese ...I will never repeat this enough NO KETCHUP in my burger!!!!I can't believe this place ranks so high in every TOP burger in London.

baD_td1srKPqqSAZHym0og.text: I've been to the one on Oxford street and have to say the burgers there were much better. This was a bit bland and the hot chick burger was not spicy at all. Not sure if the quality has gone down but they need to buck up as everyone has high expectations from them.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Burgers and chips
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

AKwOo4j8Y2y5XLXosPbNwQ.text: A little bit over-hypedBurger was good, but I was expecting something Awesome!Dark interior, lots of people, but moves pretty quickly.I had an Ari Gold, and a bite of the chicken burger, which was tasty.Ari was a bit messy, I think I was expecting too much, will try again to quantify

wnQ2Db9uPmCiOsJipVBOtg.text: Real greasy juicy burgers. I particularly love the toasted brioche bunch that had a sweet taste to it ?!I am not normally a Burger Torah but this place changed my view towards burgers. The beef patties were cooked to profession. I asked for medium rare and it is what I got. beef was very moist and juicy with no dryness nonsense. Wasn't a big fan of the chilli wings though. Way too much sauce.A Bit pricey compared to others places, sides were not included.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

EJJRPoYtlEsb5HbVqduB2g.text: One of my favourite burger places, though to be fair I've only ever had the chicken burger which is very tasty! The fries are delicious and I highly rec the rosemary salt ones!

t1R2n95rjpZXMhWAUJtElw.text: I've always been a fan of Patty&Bun, whenever I'm quizzed for my burger expertise, Patty&Bun comes top on my recommendations, unless you love chips, then Honest Burgers will hit it out the ball park for you. When I found out that you could potentially get your dirty hands on a delightful "Ari Gold" or "Smokey Robinson", without having to queue, I got straight on it.The Burgers at this joint are wonderful, they have the best toasted brioche bun I've ever laid my hands on, it's toasty, slightly sweet and perfectly in proportion with the filling. The meat is always cooked to order, medium rare means medium rare here. Thank you. The rosemary salt chips were ever so slightly too dry, but you're forgiven. When it comes to the confit wings, I've always been on the fence, The texture and fall of f the bone meat is perfect, but the taste always leave me ever so slightly perplexed. but this is a very personal preference. There are only two downsides to this place, the lack of waiting definitely isn't one. But the ambiance does seem to be lacking, if you've been to the Patty&Bun on St. James' street, this one just doesn't give the same small table cramped hipster eating feel, which I thought I hated, but turns out I love. The second complaint is the depleted menu, it's not like the original menu was extensive but they cut out "Lambshank Redemption" - a delicious lamb burger found in the St. James' St branch - not to mention the drinks too.All in all though, considering the quick service, no need to wait, how much closer it is to work. I'm thrilled that Patty&Bun have come to Liverpool St. I just hope non-foodies don't have the good fortune of stumbling across it.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Whaddup Ari Gold aka Cheeseburger
Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Ari Gold on the left, smokey Robinson on the right. Confit wings and rosemary salt chips. You know how it is.

kjoZRGl2cMshLv2Zw3aBWg.text: Who would have thought a absolutely delicious burger would be located in the middle of London! Although a very small place, these burgers are piled high and taste wonderful! a small shop, you walk in and order, they will bring this amazing burger to you! I got the Jackie Robinson and my cousin and friend got the Ari-Gold!! all of em looked great, the best part.... the fries even tasted great! if your in London and craving a great burger!! this is the place... I didn't believe a burger in London could taste this good, but it proved me wrong!! Great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. The Robinson

tz8oudWNckvkRvFY1ysD7A.text: My absolute best burger joint in the world.Never tasted a better burger than the "Smoke Cheese everyday" burger at P&B.Believe me, I've tried everywhere from greasy and dirty up to gourmet £20 burgers. None taste as good or as satisfying. Try it and you'll thank me.The chips with chicken skin salt and roast chicken mayo are to die for too.Would happily eat here everyday.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. "Smoke Cheese everyday" burgers all round

nkaDqQDJ6OoekWV5tH0B8g.text: The burgers were good - the patty was medium rare and oh so juicy. But it was the messiest burger ever to eat. They put waaaay too much sauce. Ask them to go easy on it. Plus the burger oozes out so much oil, that by the time I unwrapped it at my table minutes later, the greasepaper was completely transparent. And unusable.If they fix that burger "logistics" - less sauce and maybe drier buns that soak up the excess oil - it would be perfect.

lmZhqb99CzKkH8T7nxqoGw.text: Acclaimed as the best burger in town, my lady and me decided to have a post-flight late dinner at the small liverpool street venue.The place is much smaller than the main one (Marylebone), with some small tables on the walls. It's much more a tak-away spot, but even at 10 PM on Friday we just had to wait for 5-10 minutes before getting our table.The menu is the same as the other P&B: 4 burgers + special with some sides, that's it. Couple of sides, chicken wings and chicken legs, That's it.Now, this is going to be an endless war: Is P&B the best burger in town?! Well my opinion NO it's not. Is it a good burger? Yeah it's a pretty good burger.The burger is a mess, which can be a good thing. There is ton of sauce, ton of ingredients. If you like it, you do, I mean you really do, as you'll get your hands dripping with sauce and your mouth full of pleasant and aggressive flavors. Bu then... well.. it lacks in the quality of the patty (it's good, but not that good, and it was not very well cooked), and all sauces together do not allow anything to shine, there is no real highlights that made me appreciate the dish.I think it's something you have to try it, and then decide whether you like it or not. If you are like me, then you won't get in again in less than 6 months time, but otherwise... well lots of people consider it the best burger in London, and you may find out this is what you think about it!

G0P4WmYZw1eu6ZMj5OS43g.text: SOO juicy and so delicious! I drool every time I think about the burger... Service is really fast. Only bad thing is that when it gets busy, you have to wait a while for seats because it's such a small place.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

sfsX-f8KIbD5rkZ2o1gfjg.text: Patty and Bun is my drunk burger place. Ask anyone. I need the juicy burger to soak up the alcohol!Anyways, rolled in here around 10pm one night after drinks, and there was still a 15 minute queue. I say queue but this place is so bloody tiny, it's like a small square queue space. They have like 8 tables max and it's a squeeze. Anyways, ordered the smokey robinson which hasn't ever disappointed me. (I'm looking at you ari gold burger) and it didn't. Juicy and smokey and hits all the spots.Anyways, I've been a slow fan of P&B, my first ever visit to the Marylebone branch was a disappointment but that WAS the year of Burger Summer where I took it upon myself to try ALOT of London Burgers. (RIP my 22 year old metabolism) and it took a few more visits to really love P&B.I'm even inclined to say they cook the burgers here better than Marylebone, it's far juicier and more flavourful. Once you bite into the burger, all the noise just dissipates. That's why this place is a solid 5 stars.

s-whLly4zzzahAEReBQUhw.text: I've been to the original Patty & Bun a few times and really enjoyed it every time. My experience with the slimmed down version was a little different.  We phoned our order in advance and the pickup time was really close to when they said so full marks for that. After getting back to the office and getting stuck in I found the bags were well stocked with napkins, trays and condiments and that was a nice touch as we didn't have to ask for anything.   Unfortunately the food let everything else down slightly. I found the fries a little dry and overcooked and couldn't really taste anything from the rosemary but the biggest disappointment was the burger. I went for the Smokey Robinson and asked for all of the burgers to be medium. After biting into mine I could see that it was overcooked. There wasn't even a hint of pink to the meat and looking around at how everyone else's burger was made me slightly envious. Hopefully I was just unlucky but it definitely tarnished my experience

mO1pUasoO2l-mvEOVLG6Pg.text: You know the drill, this is Patty & Bun. Small menu. No fuss, no frills, simple, delicious and bang on every single time.Before this place opened up I might have recommended a lunchtime burger and pint for a £10 from the Water Poet, a pub nearby but now that P&B is here, everyone else has no chance. I can get my brioche and patty right here and I don't even have to queue, better yet, I don't have to go all the way to St James Street anymore. Thank the burger gods!I always get an Ari Gold, no cheese, a side of rosemary fries and a coleslaw. Yes it's a lot for a burger but I promise, you won't find a better burger in London and if you do, the service certainly won't be as fast as this P&B.

nZ5pcvQLGVwwetPyEMVIpw.text: Dined in today once I was able to get one of the 23 stools. Got Ari Gold plus bacon and Rosemary salt chips. Asked for no tomato because I'm allergic to it raw, but got it anyway (fortunately, a little residue doesn't ruin my day or kill me). I found the smoky mayo a bit too strong for my taste and the bun a bit too firm. I feel like the burger was lost. Chips were good, definitely a sharing portion. You won't leave hungry but I can't say I've found my spot for a burger when in the Liverpool Street area. Service overall was good, so I'm rounding up to three stars.

E3VVdqIgMFryylvcEtLczw.text: I just don't much care for Patty & Bun. There, I said it. I've had p&b at their original restaurant, at a food festival, and now at this branch. I want to like it, but for the reasons many people love it, I just don't enjoy it. The meat is strong and gamey tasting. The brioche bun is a bit dense and dry. The pile of juicy greasy stuff that pours off makes it messy and a bit stomach turning. The burger wouldn't stay in the bun, the cheese falls off, and the big hunk of uncut lettuce was unwieldy. The tall benches and bar stools aren't comfortable. On the upside, the service was quick, the staff so friendly, and my burger came cooked as requested and without tomato on the ari gold, just like I asked. I know I'm in the minority and that everyone there was in raptures about their food. I threw half of mine away and as I type this, I have that icky feeling you get after a McDonalds. At least there are so many other burger places that my beef fix will still be had!

BW8BTncgLbfZBpeby-8l8g.text: Woe is me, I am back studying part time. This means the loss of evenings and weekends... I am the loneliest (sometimes only) person on my tube, heading towards Liverpool street for 8:30 on a Saturday morning... BUT! There is an upside. It does mean that on a bad day, I can pop down to Patty & Bun for lunch. Saturday's are quiet and you can easily get a seat and not have to order take out and eat it in the street.A Smokey Robinson with Rosemary Fries... just deliciousness in a wrapper. The fries were crunchy and the rosemary accented them nicely. I need to ding you for the messiness though. I appreciated the wet wipe, but I needed a hand wash station. Towards the end I needed to gobble the burger (although no incentive required really) just to keep it from spilling on to the tray. Napkins would not have saved me... I'll be back, but I'll be wearing my messy clothes!

n2WuoQqqtBngUFDVbfYkqA.text: I decided to give Patty & Bun another go as I remember being slightly underwhelmed the first time I went. This time, I tried the newer location because I knew if there wasn't seating, I could get it to go. (I had to get it to go). I got the Smoky Robinson because everyone says it's the best. I also got a side of chips, but upgraded to the chicken salt and chicken mayo instead of the Rosemary, because last time I had the chips, there was no Rosemary flavor anyway.The burger was fine. It was tasty, but again, like before, it was lacking a little something that I really want in my burger, namely an amazing tasting burger. The toppings and things just kind of took away from it all. And the chips were lack-luster at best. Slightly soggy and I wouldn't have guessed that they were supposed to taste like chicken if I hadn't ordered them. They just were quite bland and boring. I didn't even finish them. Which is disappointing.In all honesty, there are SO many better burger places I would choose to go to, that I definitely won't really be back here (as one of my favorites is quite close by). It's definitely cementing in my mind that the most popular does not necessarily equal the best. Patty and Bun is a popular burger joint in London, but far from the best. Don't just listen to the herd, but do a bit of research on your own and try something else.

vtyMpnxuza7PMtr5xatBaA.text: Yum!  Patty & Bun is always popular, so a queue is to be expected - to order and to sit, if that's what you want to do.But it's got a great buzzy atmosphere and great tunes.Choosing your burger from the selection available can be tricky as they're all so tempting!  But be warned, this will be no sophiscated dining experience!  These burgers are sloppy and delicious - take lots of napkins!

xZdPpHqDDaHCNahGJh_dDQ.text: This was a carb-coma inducing lunch which I did regret about an hour into the dreadfully boring insurance presentations I had to endure in the afternoon.But I love P&B in general and seized the opportunity to introduce my fellow Birmingham based colleagues accompanying me to the Smoke to the place. Absolutely smashed a smokey Robinson with brisket chips and a Ting. Service excellent, only waited a few minutes despite it being peak lunch time, and didn't get a drop on my crisp white shirt.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Nom

Mls2cqI-l7LNaV0hKuKJzw.text: Are you having a bubble? This place is f*cking awesome. Okay so the first time I went was after work, was feeling a bit cranky and met up with an old mate. Grabbed a drink, felt hungry. Someone recommended Patty and Bun at the bar. Idk, the guy was a hipster looking fellow, I just assumed he knew what he was talking about in Shoreditch. Well he was right. I walked in, they're playing Skepta on the speakers. Full volume. That track 'Numbers'. Tune and a half. I order 'Ari Gold' (cheese burger). Juicy. Greasy. Flavoursome. Soft buns. F*ck me I'll order another son. Anyway...this became a regular burger place I hit. 9/10 for the taste (all their burgers are decent). Atmosphere was 8.5/10. View?..view of my burger and 1L of beer was decent. 8.5/10. I recommend Patty and Bun to all.

XkUzIHUzP3Z6L5BcBX0I2A.text: Very good burger joint. I had the Lambshank Redemption Burger, the quality of the meat is high and the burger is cooked properly, in addition the feta is tasty as well and pairs well with the lamb meat. The price (£9) is not low but considering that there is not an additional price for eating-in and the service is quite good and friendly it is reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

IB7MvhQTHKMNkSkmxnH91A.text: Tasty burger, expensive beer (around 4 quid for a can of craft). I had the Smokey Robinson, and it was as good as they say. Would definitely come back for that - messy but delicious, so recommended if you're more hungry than thirsty. 5 stars are justified, because you get what you need here!

XzXUYMEO8lWu8Nf86poYvg.text: We were in the area for a business meeting. It was late at night and there weren't many places that were open. We stumbled upon Patty & Bun and noticed a small crowd gathered outside for take-out. We took this as a good sign and decided to give it a try.This place packs a punch for a little hole in the wall! The food is well seasoned and the meat patties were cooked just right. The coleslaw had a good kick to it and paired well with the "Smokey Robinson" burger I ordered. The brisket nuggets were tasty and something I had never tried before. The staff were friendly and courteous. There aren't many tables to dine-in but that didn't pose a problem given the time of day of our visit.

VGiEzTaiWh5yY-p7HEufmw.text: Definitely one of the best burger places in town that's surely going to put you in a food coma! This branch is a lot smaller compared to the main Marylebone one but a fraction of the waiting time. It gets busy during lunch hours with all the city workers but they have a quick take away window just like in a lot of New York munchies. It's full of messy goodness and I usually go for the Ari gold which just oozes with melted cheese and caramelised onions on top of the juicy beef. (It really gets messy so I wouldn't recommend eating it outside!) And now the bbq chicken wings are hard to miss...it just falls off the bone! I definitely want to try the crispy chicken burger next time which just spills out from the bun with lots of garlic aioli!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom

IdE1XY23-r0cBKpWERkJ_w.text: Is the line worth it?Eh....Every single time I see patty & bun the line is ridiculous. I always think to myself that it must be worth it, otherwise people would not be standing in the cold/rain for a burger. So one day I decided to go and see for myself, upon a coworkers recommendation I arrived at 3:30pm (read this as: not lunch time). The burger was decent, but certainly not the best I've had. The wings were pretty solid though.It's a good burger, but doesn't live up to the hype and I don't think I'd wait in line for more than 3-5 minutes for it.

46Q1blFm22Hye5CYR3KkWw.text: This is supposed to be one of the best burger places in London. It was relatively priced. The phone was decent. I'm was good but think there have to be better places than this burger place in London.

ecYJUdH1Y1ZH8OlsTFRU5Q.text: My previous experience Patty&Bun experience was the one over at James Street. I would say this branch over here at Liverpool Street is more of a take-away place compared and had to wait quite a while for us to get a table. I went for the Arigold cheeseburger with a side of rosemary salt chips. The beef patty was juicy, mayo and ketchup were added to the right amount sandwiched between two warm fluffy brioche. Rosemary chips gave off a good crisp too! Would head back for the consistency of quality in their burgers!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Arigold!

7TcwHs65JFXS0_s4lp7M1Q.text: The magic of Patty & Bun - cooking up the juiciest burger on soft brioche that isn't falling apart. I opened my takeaway order to find that the juices were running, and braced myself to find the buns mushy. However, the brioche held up as I devoured the burger. The Smoky Robinson is the way to go if you love smoked anything. It is served with smoked mayo on bacon and caramelized onion, which basically means that it will hit that bacon craving a thousand times over and leave you salivating. I was also impressed that the relatively small burger (coming from the states) kept me full for a long time, which I believe speaks to the quality of the burger. There will be a queue, but do not be intimidated as it moves quickly.

za1UcMhLHhlp3bhxURGvxg.text: Burgers are delicious, not too expensive and service is fast and friendly. Great for after drinks hunger. However the music is way too loud and we asked for it to be lowered a bit but with little results.

a_vBFGEdnQYK_pjBDOb0nA.text: I went here on a friday night and it was too full to sit inside so we got takaeaway burgers.I got the chilli burger and it was the sloppiest juiciest, hardest to eat burger I may ever have had. But even as I sat eating it on the steps outside Macdonalds, dripping greasy juice all over myself, it was still a great dining experience (I promise!). The burger is full of flavour, the bread is soft, the toppings were tasty, the chips were perfect, the chilli I got with the chips was so good that I considered taking the dregs of it I didn't eat home.I'll definitely be back to Patty and Bun and hopefully I'll get a table this time!

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Worth the mess.

A2Om6dr3zTd6yuIsLwTzqQ.text: Ordered chilli burger with fries and bbq chicken wings. Everything was on point. Burger was juicy (chilli sauce is my favourite now and its not that spicy) bun was very moist. Fries has a very nice authentic taste (fries with rosemary). Bbq chicken wing were soooo delicious, the meat was very soft with very good bbq sauce (tasted very similar to korean bbq sauces). But the actual place is very small. So if you wanna eat in place, be prepared to wait at least 10-15min. Other than that, very nice and authentic place. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. Chilli burger

5mqguPaPs3ZRwv9Izuse0g.text: P&B was just not as good as I hoped it would be based on my husband's singing praises. The service was friendly and we were somehow able to snag one of the two-top tables at 12:30pm on a Saturday but the food just let me down.I ordered the Ari Gold minus the mayo because mayo is gross and it was delivered to our table within an acceptable amount of time, perhaps 10 minutes from ordering. It was cooked well, possibly a little overcooked for having ordered it cooked medium though. I unwrapped it and juices were flowing which was a delightful sign but that's sort of where the delightfulness ended.I found the burger to be tasteless but found the cheese to be very flavorful which was strange. I don't think I've ever consumed a cheeseburger and actually tasted the cheese. Anyway, the bun was soggy due to soaking up a lot of the juice (grease?) and therefore started to fall apart after a couple of bites. The biggest downfall to my burger was that it was room-temperature-borderline-cold.Would possibly give P&B another go in the future but would likely give other burger joints a go first.

iovlYaDu8AGSqjycrRC4cQ.text: I love it already. I've got to try more stuff here. I have had their chicken burger, regular burger and what not. I love their coleslaw too.Portobello mushroom burger is fantastic for vegetarians. Some amazing sides are on the menu too. Tamarind Thighs are something you'd wanna try. But remember, if you thought sides were small, you are wrong. Tamarind thighs actually deserve a place among the mains but is probably only on the sides menu because it is not a burger. One portion of Tamarind Thighs comes with three yummy chicken thighs. Only order this in addition to your burger if you are really hungry or if you have someone to share it with else you won't be able to finish it. Very sumptuous indeed.Trust me you'll love it anyway. Will update this review later. I'm too hungry nowSo to give you an update on what I had the other day, I was slightly disappointed at the amount of oil that was oozing out of the burger. I felt they could do a little more to drain it out first before putting the patty between the buns. Apart from that everything else was good. Enjoyed the Tamarind thighs too.

MI8pMcaIbTxLbQH-zlrOLw.text: The burgers are to die for here, not to talk about the rosemary potatoes, simply fried and salted perfectly. If you're looking for a good burger and are not the McDonalds pr BurgerKing lovers, just go directly here and will not remain disappointed.

gQKhiVjUFzkulq5XDyYFXw.text: I wish I could have given Patty & Bun 5 stars but I was irritated and disappointed that we had to wait for a table for quite a while. You don't have the luxury of being able to book a table, so it is a bit stressful and not relaxed. I went at lunchtime (around 12:30pm/1:00pm) on a week day.I ordered the Ari Gold cheeseburger which was very tasty, it was so juicy and very yummy indeed. Next up, my brother and I shared the Thunder Thighs with Tamarind glaze, it was a delicious sweet sauce but surprisingly spicy, so this blew me away a bit! It was all yummy but obviously annoying that no fries came with the burger, despite paying the £7.50 for no table reservation and no table services (you have to go up and order...)It would be so so great if you could book a table, and to have the ease of a waiter or waitress coming to your table. It was my brother's birthday and it would have made the experience so much more enjoyable. I wouldn't have dared going for dinner, I can imagine the queues and waiting time being a joke at dinner hours...I do recommend, but only if you don't mind the stress of waiting for a while and eagerly keeping your eye out for a table...

vm4TQNqD1vQls3zIuIVP9Q.text: Patty & Bun serves up a good burger, but it didn't blow me away.For starters, I think I went in with excessively high expectations.  A friend of mine who's quite a foodie, the type that knows Heston Blumenthal dishes by name and has dozens of Michelin stars under his belt, told me that Patty & Bun was his favorite new school London burger.  And the reviews are universally good across multiple platforms.  So when my wife was craving a burger on a recent Sunday, we decided to venture down to the one across from Liverpool Street Station.  The place is small and a little messy, with stuff stacked up everywhere and slightly sticky tables.  The petite pierced woman who took our order was moderately abrupt.  I thought it was odd that the burgers come with so many toppings by default - if they're known for quality ingredients, wouldn't they want to let those shine rather than slathering them with stuff?  We ordered our cheeseburgers plain (meat, cheese, bun) to test this theory, with a single order of chips to split.They were good.  But not amazing.  The beef was flavorful, but very much unseasoned (hence the toppings, I guess?).  It tasted grass-fed, a little gamey, but juicy and well-cooked.  The cheese was pretty bland, no bite to it.  And the bun was fine, but nothing to write home about.  The chips were similar to Honest Burger's, with rosemary and salt, but a little better, I'd say.  So overall, a respectable burger, but not usually what I'm going to crave - I typically either want a greasy, salty fast food burger like at Meat Mission, or a high end burger a la Daniel Bouloud.  For those who want something in between, with a buttload of toppings, you can go to Patty & Bun.  I won't stand in your way.

ERJMF7j0e1ONvlvF8F-ARw.text: Oh, Patty & Bun, you haven for the messiest most delicious burgers I've ever had the pleasure of eating. No other burger can compare to you in my eyes. I cannot stop signing praises for this place or for this burger. Dinner on my first night back in Liverpool and of course I'm gonna get the Smokey Robinson for take away. Brought it back to my flat and pretty much devoured it within minutes. Caramelised onions and bacon on a juicy medium rare patty, balanced between a sweet brioche bun. Basically perfection! All the words in the world can't accurately describe how tasty these burgers are so I think you're just gonna have to come here and try it for yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. my favourite kind of take away

AwNgVkaIETNgwN4bZUEcXA.text: So I have been to the other patty & bun near Bond Street and was blown away by the burgers! I stumbled upon this chain last weekend and was shocked there was another establishment so close on the way home for me.  I dragged along a friend already prefacing the visit by proclaiming that this will be the best burger he will have.  He was not disappointed! He did have to alter his choice from the Smoky Robinson which although they were happy to remove the bacon due to his religious reasons they did mention that the caramelised onions were cooked with pork therefore be weary and ask if you have any special dietary requirements.  The establishment is quite small, enough to cater to 10-15 people however due to the location in Liverpool Street you can see how it is ideal for the busy takeaway lunch. Now onto my food, and my god the food is unbelievable! It's messy, it's fun, it's quite simply delicious!! The chips were served with a special roast chicken mayo which was nice but the best bit was quite simply the burger. I went for the lamb shank redemption (GREAT NAME, GREAT FILM) and the lamb was really nice as was the gherkins in the burger.  I would highly recommend it for any burger lover out there with the total cost of the meal with the drink coming in under £13.

photos.caption: Photo of Patty & Bun - London, United Kingdom. lambshank redemption!!
